text: do you ever find you have a positive
desire to do something meaningful with
your life but then when you start
thinking about all the ways to achieve
this you become overwhelmed with the
whats and the hows before you know it
you've completely given up and your
day-to-day existence is back to Doom
scrolling on your phone you feel stuck
wishing your life was more fulfilling
and had a purpose well it sounds like
you might be struggling with motivation
but what if I told you that the answer
to this is simple doctors Edwin Locke
and Gary Latham spent 30 years
pioneering Research into goal setting
and motivation devising the goal-setting
theory a clear set of principles that
not only gets to the root of what keeps
us motivated but assists in helping us
to achieve our goals in essence setting
yourself clear goals that were specific
and challenging though not too
challenging while also receiving
appropriate feedback were found to be
key in sustaining motivation leading to
a greater possibility of success towards
achieving their desired goal well that's
great you might say but I don't actually
know how to motivate myself here are a
few tips to help you get unstuck and mo

more fulfilling life our first step is
to write it down let's try something get
a pen and paper set yourself a timer for
five minutes and write down the answers
to these questions what do I want to
achieve in my life what changes what I
like to see in the world don't think too
much about it just let your instincts
take over and your writing hand roam
free on the page this exercise is to

how to increase motivation and drive
Andrew huberman emphasizes the
importance of identifying your values
but more importantly aligning them with
your goals having well-defined goals
that are aligned with our values
provides us with an authentic sense of
purpose and Direction putting it simply
when we have something to strive for it
gives us a sense of purpose but we are
more likely to stay motivated and
focused on our tasks if we care deeply
about them our next tip is to get
s-m-a-r-t smart now we've established
what your values are you should be ready
to set goals which are aligned to those

towards achieving your Ambitions but
before we rush off down this road and
risk getting lost losing motivation all
over again it's important to have a plan
in place that keeps us accountable in
our quest to meet our goals we need to
get
s-m-a-r-t smart in 1990 lock and Latham
published their work a theory of goal
setting and task performance outlining
five major characteristics that were
required for successful goal setting an
easy way to remember these
characteristics can be achieved by
remembering the acronym
s-m-a-r-t specific measurable acceptable
realistic time bound let's go through
these for example let's say your major
ambition in life is to inspire and
Influence People by competing at the
Olympic Games but in order to compete at
the Olympics you need to become a

best shape of your life so how can we
apply the smart method instead of
setting yourself the vague and
intimidating goal of getting into the
best shape of your life it's important
to be realistic taking into account your
current Fitness level and how much you
can actually achieve at this early stage
for example you could start by going for
a run for 30 minutes three times a week
this goal already includes specificity
I.E going for a run and is measurable
I.E 30 minutes three times a week
tracking your results over the first
four weeks you might start to get an
idea of how much distance you can run in
30 minutes and subsequently want to push
yourself to get a faster time over the
next four week period keep setting new
goals keep tracking your performance
slowly you will improve and with
Improvement comes results and increased
motivation it's important to apply a
Time deadline to your goals in this
instance trying to better your personal
best run time within a four weekly
period as it helps to keep you motivated
to strive to better your previous
performances so far we've covered s
specify M measurable R realistic and T

when you're having a bad day that you're
